comment_data.body:
also,
python:

>>> whatsapi.sendMessage("1","NUMBER","test")
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "whatsapi.py", line 99, in sendMessage
    s.send(msg)
socket.error: [Errno 32] Broken pipe
Do you get any output after the login? There should be something about account_info. If not you seems not able to log in.
On Android, for password shall we use DeviceID or IMEI? Those are not the same.

Seems like nobody has figured out yet how the password on an iOS device is being generated, so I wrote a little Python script that helps you reset it to a custom value: http://lukasklein.com/blog/custom-ios-whatsapp-password/
Same issue happens to me. Login seems not to happen successfully despite of using md5(strrev("myimei")) as password.

With Android, it's the IMEI. Just the plain IMEI.

@lukashed  good one, but as you figured it'll break the original client's experience. That's why we went after retrieving the generated password.
resetting the password like you suggest @lukashed doesnt help me. i want to still use my iPhone client too. Anyone? im no getting anything like @dsdsfga suggested about the account_info...

I confirm that UDID in Android is `md5(strrev("myimeiwhateveritis"))`.
Finally got it to work but. I am able to get account info but not to send any message.
Well, in some cases you may need to  flush the incoming messages buffer in order to send.
no update on iphone password?
@aloncarmel , try this http://lukasklein.com/blog/custom-ios-whatsapp-password/ it will reset your password
@mo-mughrabi im not looking to disable my iphone client but building another client.

Fully working at the moment and having lots of fun.
I've forked the project and soon I'll commit some tweaks and tools.
Great job!
aesedepece, a working example for Python-Android would be most welcome!
@aesedepece could you plz tell me how did you solve your problem? I can also login but still not able to send any message.
no word on iphone password / php login? or is it just the login problem that is preventing the php from working?

@neds Resetting my password with the method @lukashed and @mo-mughrabi mentioned worked for me:

* I set my password to be my reversed and hashed IMEI. (This disabled my Android client).
* Then I enabled my Android client by standard method → SMS confirmation code.
* Eventually it worked with both API and Android.

You may find you are able to login using the API but not to send anything. As @hubail commented, «in some cases you may need to flush the incoming messages buffer in order to send». This can be achieved with `read()` twice or thrice in PHP or: `s.recv(1024)` in Python.
@aesedepece flush the incoming message buffer? did you have any example ?
Flushing the incoming buffer is just performing `read()` until there is no answer.

@aesedepece Flushing , but still can't send ... [root@hv php]# php example.php

account_info

Array ( [status] => active [kind] => free [creation] => 1288493592 [expiration] => 1635562392 )

--start-- --end--
The "last" commit has another encryptPassword ().. that detect if you put a "mac", and twice it... else, is supposed that is a imei, and reversed

title: Not being able to connect
